text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: Mobbing at work in Poland: how to protect your rights and get support

Workplace mobbing in Poland is a serious problem that negatively affects the mental and physical health of employees. According to research, 93% of employees have encountered this issue. There is a legislative framework in the country to combat mobbing, as well as government institutions and organizations that can be contacted for support.
explains what mobbing is, the situation with this phenomenon in Poland, how it is regulated by legislation, and where to seek help in case of its manifestations at work.

Poland presented a vision of Ukraine's agricultural Eurointegration

On December 4, an important working meeting was held between Ukrainian and Polish agricultural associations, as well as representatives of the relevant ministries of the two countries. The meeting was attended by the Ministers of Agricultural Policy of Ukraine and Poland.

üìç Czes≈Çaw Sekerzy≈Ñski, the Polish Minister of Agriculture, during his speech at the Agro&Food Security Forum 2024, shared the key aspects of the discussions:

‚úÖ Poland's vision for the future presidency of the EU and Ukraine's European integration was presented.
‚úÖ The prospects for cooperation after June 5, 2025, were discussed, including trade and product processing.
‚úÖ A joint export of processed products was proposed as an effective alternative to raw material exports.

üîπ Special attention was paid to the issue of stabilizing the Polish market. According to the minister, measures already taken to allay the concerns of Polish producers are showing a positive effect.

üîú The next online meeting is scheduled for December 11 to continue the dialogue between Ukrainian and Polish ministries and associations.

The joint cooperation of Poland and Ukraine in the agricultural sector becomes an important step towards the integration and development of both countries in the EU.

From 2025, there will be another official holiday in Poland.

The Polish Sejm passed a bill making December 24, Christmas Eve (Vigilia), an official public holiday. This decision will take effect from 2025, so in 2024, December 24 will remain a working day. In addition, from 2025 there will be three shopping Sundays before Christmas, which will make holiday shopping more convenient.
before Christmas will be on December 15 and 22.

How Ukrainians created a children's choir in Wroc≈Çaw and helped those affected by the flood

Maria Kolomiiets (Masha Kapusta) and Serhiy Bilozerov lived in Kharkiv before the full-scale invasion. They had their own art-theatrical studio 'Tsvitna Kapusta' and created cultural projects. The war forced Maria and her daughters to move to Poland. Later, Serhiy joined them. In Poland, they continued their activities - volunteering, creating a children's choir, and making plans for the future. Moreover, during the flood that affected Poland in the fall, they actively helped the victims.

We talked to Maria and Sergiy and learned about how they create projects for Ukrainian children, why they are involved in helping Poland, and why they think understanding and cooperation between cultures is important.

How Ukrainians can open individual entrepreneurial activity (JDG) in Poland
Ukrainians in Poland can start individual economic activity.
describes the features of running this type of business in Poland.
Hello, how are you?

‚û°Ô∏è Individual economic activity is a form of business operation that is analogous to the Ukrainian FOP. To register such an enterprise, there is no need to conclude founding contracts or provide data on starting capital. It is only necessary to register the company in the list of economic activities (CEIDG). It is worth noting that for all decisions and actions regarding the company, the entrepreneur is liable with their personal property, such as real estate, income from other paid activities, and so on. The structure of JDG offers a straightforward approach to managing profits, taxes, and administrative expenses. Unlike limited liability companies (Sp. z o.o.), which require full accounting and additional costs for profit distribution, JDG simplifies financial management by providing direct access to business income. üìé

Duties of an intercultural assistant in Polish schools

A cross-cultural assistant is a person who provides support to foreign students in school, particularly in adaptation, learning, and integration. They also help teachers and school administration establish communication with the child and their parents.

Talked with Tetyana Bulana, an intercultural assistant and head of the "SonderTime" foundation. She explained whether there have been any changes in the work of an intercultural assistant, what his duties are, and what issues you can approach him with.

December 15 and 22 in Poland are trading Sundays

Already this Sunday, December 15, all stores and supermarkets in Poland will be open. This will allow better preparation for the holidays and shopping on a day off. The next Sunday, December 22, will also be trading.
fall on Wednesday and Thursday (December 25 and 26). If you want to relax during the holiday period, it is worth taking a vacation on December 23, 24, 27, 30, and 31.
How and when did trading Sundays appear in Poland?
‚Äî a term that means, on a certain Sunday of the year, grocery stores, supermarkets, shopping centers, and

All over Poland, they operate on a regular schedule. However, on other public holidays and Sundays, there is a law prohibiting trade.

This restriction was introduced because employees prefer to rest on the seventh day of the week and spend it with their family. A similar law is in place in other EU countries, such as Germany, Austria, Switzerland, France, Finland, Spain, and Portugal.

The ban on Sunday trading in Poland was introduced gradually from 2018. In the first year after the law came into effect, shops were open two Sundays a month. A year later, the number decreased to one Sunday a month. Currently, in 2024, shopping is only possible on days designated by the government.

How Ukrainians can apply for disability in Poland

Ukrainians with disabilities need to undergo the procedure of confirming their medical diagnosis again in Poland, as the documents issued in Ukraine are not recognized by the Polish healthcare system and do not grant the right to benefits.
We explain which documents need to be prepared and where Ukrainians in Poland should apply to register a disability.
Labor market benefits for mothers with children
Mothers who work in Poland have a number of benefits during pregnancy and childcare. Among them are additional days off, vacations, breaks for breastfeeding, and a ban on overtime work.
we tell on the portal what types of vacations, supplements, and aids are available for working moms in Poland.
Features of the grading system in Polish schools
The Polish grading system differs from the Ukrainian one and has its own scale and grades.
we discuss the system of assessing knowledge and behavior in a Polish school, what is the measure and weight of the assessment, and how and when a student can improve semester grades.
What are the differences between different types of medical care in Poland

In Poland, there are several types of medical care. Ukrainians should know in which cases they should contact the emergency department, a primary care physician, or the night and holiday medical service.
tells how to properly choose a medical service in Poland to receive medical assistance quickly and without unnecessary difficulties.
What fakes and manipulations were spread among Ukrainians on social networks in November
The Foundation 'Institute Poland-Ukraine' and the portal '
continue monitoring within the framework of the project aimed at countering the spread of fake, manipulative, and hateful narratives among Ukrainians in Poland

In November, it was possible to monitor over 40 different pages on Telegram, Facebook, and TikTok, whose audience consists of Ukrainians abroad. In this text, we will present the most striking examples of fakes and manipulations that were spread among Ukrainians in Poland in November of this year. Read the new article on the website.

Financial assistance "Active
and
in the kindergarten" ‚Äì why it is worth applying by January 2
What is your name?

"active in kindergarten" can be submitted no earlier than the day the child starts attending a kindergarten or a children's club, or when they come under the care of a day caregiver.

‚û°Ô∏è If parents submit an application within 3 months after the law comes into force, i.e., by January 2, 2025, they will be entitled to receive a benefit for the previous months (i.e., from October, if other conditions are met).

‚û°Ô∏è From January 3, new application submission deadlines for "active in kindergarten" benefits come into effect. To be eligible for benefits from the day the child started attending kindergarten, parents must submit an application within 2 months from that day.

‚û°Ô∏è They will also receive a benefit for the month in which the child started attending kindergarten, even if they submit the application the following month.

If parents submit an application after 2 months have passed from the day the child started attending kindergarten, the benefit will only be provided from the month of application submission. Benefits for previous months will not be granted.

Since October 1, 2024, the "Active Parents" (Aktywny Rodzic) program has been launched in Poland. Ukrainians who meet certain requirements are also eligible for financial support under this program.

Insurance for students in Polish school

School insurance for students in Polish schools provides financial protection in case of accidents that may occur not only during school education but also outside of it. School insurance in Poland is a type of accident insurance (nastƒôpstw nieszczƒô≈õliwych wypadk√≥w) or abbreviated (NNW). The insurance policy can be purchased for primary and secondary school students.
we explain school insurance, what expenses it covers, and whether it is mandatory in Poland.
How Ukrainians can arrange temporary guardianship in Poland

üìå Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, children without parents have arrived in Poland accompanied by relatives or close ones. However, for the stay of children in Poland to be legal, they must have a temporary guardian appointed by a Polish court.

üìå Temporary guardianship is a legal procedure that allows relatives or close persons to provide proper care for children.

üìå A temporary guardian can be appointed for children who have arrived in Poland as a result of the military actions in Ukraine without the accompaniment of parents or legal guardians. This person not only helps to ensure the legal stay of the minor but also must take care of their safety and the protection of their rights in the new country.
on our portal, we tell you how to properly arrange temporary guardianship in Poland and which steps need to be taken for this.

This myth spreads bias, creates social tension, and negatively affects the Ukrainian community.
we explain what the involvement of Ukrainians in the Polish labor market actually looks like.

The minimum wage in Poland increased to 4666 PLN gross!

From January 1, 2025, there was a second increase in the minimum wage in Poland for this year. The minimum wage is now 4666 PLN gross, and the hourly rate has increased to 30.1 PLN gross. This increase is the result of a government decision aimed at supporting workers amid rising inflation and strengthening the labor market.
Reminder
that from June 2023 in Poland a two-tier system for raising the minimum wage per year was established - in January and July. This is already the second stage of the increase.

Attention: a new type of fraud with fake fines in Poland!
üìÑ Polish police warn: fraudsters are sending out fake fines with QR codes, which can lead to the loss of personal data or access to a bank account. üí°
How do fraudsters work?

Fake documents are left under the car wiper or in the mailbox. They feature logos of government institutions, case numbers, and even signatures of authorized persons. They contain a QR code or a link for payment through the BLIK system. Scammers offer a "50% discount" if the fine is paid within 24 hours.
It's important to know:
Real fines in Poland are issued
personally
at the place of violation or after being summoned by the police. Documents left under the windshield wiper can only be a summons to the police for an explanation, but not a fine.
How to provide for yourself?
Do not act in haste: it is important to verify any document or message. Do not scan negative QR codes. Check the sources of information - official websites always end with
Contact the police or municipal police in case of doubt. Never leave your bank or personal information on suspicious sites.
Corrective-compensatory classes for students in a Polish school

One type of therapeutic support for children in Polish schools is correctional-compensatory classes, aimed at helping children who have learning difficulties improve their skills and adapt to the learning process.

Tatiana Bulana, an intercultural assistant and head of the 'SonderTime' foundation, helped us understand the issues related to correctional-compensatory classes in school.
